label: Proton Lifetime
mathematical_goal: Derive proton lifetime tau_p > 10^35 years from M_GUT = 2.1e16 GeV, safely above Super-Kamiokande bounds
theoretical_significance: Proton stability is a stringent test of GUT theories. Most GUT models predict tau_p ~ 10^32-10^35 years, within Super-K reach. PM predicts tau_p > 10^35 years due to: (1) Higher M_GUT from geometric derivation, (2) Suppression from TCS discrete torsion (factor S^2 ~ 4.5). The prediction tau_p ~ 10^35.5 years is above current bounds (1.6e34 years) but potentially testable by Hyper-Kamiokande.
